title: Calories in Filet Mignon
meta_description: Discover calories in filet mignon per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for this lean beef cut.
assumptions: Lean beef tenderloin steak, trimmed of fat, cooked by grilling or broiling, no added oil, butter, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, fat trimming, cooking method, and source; values are approximate. Check labels or USDA data for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked filet mignon provides ~213 kcal and ~30.5 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp butter during cooking per 100 g
Untrimmed with visible fat (vs. lean trimmed) per 100 g
Pan-seared with 1 tsp oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g filet mignon?
faqs.a: Approximately 213 kcal for lean, cooked filet mignon.

faqs.q: Is filet mignon high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 100 g provides about 30.5 g of protein.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in filet mignon?
faqs.a: Around 9.2 g total fat per 100 g, with 3.6 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in filet mignon?
faqs.a: Yes, grilling keeps it lean; frying with oil adds 30-50 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: How does filet mignon compare to other steaks calorie-wise?
faqs.a: It's leaner than ribeye (higher fat) but similar to sirloin; ~213 kcal vs. 250+ for fattier cuts per 100 g.
